Obese pregnant women are at increased risk of vitamin D deficiency compared with women with healthy body 
weight. Obesity reduces the bioavailability of vitamin D and, in one study, over half of the obese women were 
vitamin D deficient. It is also suggested that adipose tissue has its own requirements for Vitamin D (a fat-soluble 
vitamin) and in pregnancy vitamin D is drawn from maternal reserves [137]. The higher the maternal adipose 
tissues stores, the greater the vitamin D requirem
